results.content:
I've gone through about a fifth of the course till now so this review is based on my current progress. Mr Edwin's style of teaching is fantastic as always and he keeps the student going with his inspiring words. The basics of Codeigniter will not be difficult to pick up (familiarity with OOP is assumed) after a few lectures even though one might have no idea of what MVC is. It's always useful to back up this hands on project based tutorial with theoretical references on the official Codeigniter websites.
I enrolled for this course because Codeigniter is supposed to be the easiest way to learn the MVC framework. There have been negative opinions about the future of this framework especially after the rise of Laravel and the huge popularity that it now has garnered. Still, a lot of programmers do say that Codeiginiter is the best way to enter the world of frameworks. Maybe Mr Diaz will offer his valued opinion on that, maybe even start a course on Laravel in which I will personally happily enrol. Best to learn all :)
Finally, this is a great course and worth our time and money. Thank you Mr Edwin.

I feel like even the most junior of PHP developer could come out of this course confident with using CI3 and have learned a ton. results.content: Just finished the final lecture. Solid introduction to the MVC framework. I feel motivated to learn more about Codeigniter, PHP, and Bootstrap, so I can build on the framework. The instructor can move quite quickly at times, which means you get a lot of material, but you have to be willing to pause and rewind frequently to understand everything in detail. The instructor clearly loves what he's doing, the presentation is clear and enthusiastic. Having completed numerous programming courses on udemy, I feel calling the instructor the best programming instructor on udemy is justified. Definitely worth my (and your) time.

In geringerem Umfang mag das für den Schüler noch lehrreich sein, aber so ist es unfassbar langweilig. Vieles wiederholt sich immer wieder und von CodeIgniter wird eigentlich nur ein Bruchteil dargestellt. Ein bis zwei Stunden hätten lock gereicht. results.content:
What can I say. Edwin is the best instructor I have come across on Udemy (I am signed up with more than 60 courses - so I say that with some experience). He has a passion for PHP and MySQL that he shares intimately with his students. He will listen to questions and requests and add lectures built around those questions and requests. Again I can only speak for myself. He added some lessons within a few days in response to a question I had asked. Those extra lesson have increased my understanding of the subject as doing the lessons were going to benefit me not just intellectually but also improving my confidence when working on projects for my clients...
Like may of his students I am eagerly awaiting new course by Edwin like a movie fan waiting for the next epic starring their favourite actor. In this case Edwin!

results.content:
Overall, the course material helped me get started and the instructor is very enthusiastic and easy to follow.  I really appreciate the time it took to plan, record, and edit the videos in a way that the students can stay focused.

I would suggest that the instructor can provide better guidance with regards to best coding practices like code structure and readability.  As someone who has coding experience outside of web development, reading the tutorial code took some effort.

But like I said, overall the content of this course was more than enough to get me started with my own project and I can say that I am more comfortable developing with CodeIgniter, PHP, and HTML because of what I learned through this course.

Thank you.

The example projects are a little slow but are detailed enough for you to get a real world application up an running.

All in all, a very good beginners course.  If you understand the concepts of MVC and have already used a PHP MVC framework, such as Zend Framework 1, then this course may still benefit you.

results.content:
I took this course following on from a procedural PHP course, as I needed to learn CodeIgniter for a new job. 
I am quite new to coding, and some of the concepts can be difficult to grasp, but Edwin is quite good at explaining things.
He's always very quick to respond to queries if your stuck and the QA section is a really good resource, as others have probably come across the same issues in the past.
Overall, this is a very good course that I would highly recommend  for anyone wishing to learn the fundamentals of CodeIgniter. 
Money well spent.

I found this course one of the best I have taken in terms of pacing, level and progression of difficulty, and quantity of material covered. I was often able to try to go ahead of the instructor a bit, actually make things work, then check to see what Edwin Diaz did and compare it to my solution. That helped me learn a lot faster and become more comfortable with the material.

One of the most compelling aspects of the course was that Edwin Diaz obviously is enthusiastic about the subject, and he clearly is teaching his students, not dryly presenting material.

results.content:
My favourite thing about Edwin's course is that it isn't scripted. It isn't all pre-planned, laid-out, and everything goes perfectly the first time, every time. It feels like a live coding session - where mistakes are made, and you get to see the debugging process - something that a LOT of courses completely miss. 

It makes it more real - and makes you feel good when you see the error - and wait to see how long it takes for it to be found. 

He does a great job explaining the concepts of the framework, and really builds on that foundation as you go. 

An added perk, he's always so happy and animated, it makes you look forward to firing up the next lecture. If you've stumbled on to boring, monotonous instructors that turn you off their courses ... this is NOT one of them.

results.content:
I wish I knew about this a year ago. It would have saved me almost a year of work. I don't like all those heavy frameworks so I was building my own. This is way better. Edwin basically walk through the creation of a project which was very helpful and provided me a lot of insights. I was able to copy the project code to my server and run it with very minor config changes and start editing it within minutes. Within a day I had already customized it for one of my projects. 

I have only 2 complaints. 
1) he used the alternative style of PHP for web pages even if there was no HTML. Every line of PHP was wrapped in php tags for some reason. Plus he puts lots of blank lines everywhere. Not just double spaced. Lot's of blank lines everywhere. I did a search and replace to remove all blank lines and manually added the ones I thought were appropriate. 
2) During his instruction he would switch between files quickly and sometimes without any warning. It was difficult to stay on top of which file he is editing because there were no clear indications of when he switched and what he switched to. I had to pause often and inspect the screen to see the file names. I watched the video at double speed so that was part of the problem but I normally can follow everything at that speed. It would have been very helpful if the video had the current file name posted somewhere prominently. 

I really enjoyed learning from Edwin. He is a great and passionate instructor and I'll most likely get other courses from him.

It was difficult to stay on top of which file he is editing because there were no clear indications of when he switched and what he switched to. I had to pause often and inspect the screen to see the file names. I watched the video at double speed so that was part of the problem but I normally can follow everything at that speed. It would have been very helpful if the video had the current file name posted somewhere prominently.

I really enjoyed learning from Edwin. He is a great and passionate instructor and I'll most likely get other courses from him.

results.content: Edwin is a dedicated instructor who wants his students to do well. This course has given me a solid understanding of MVC design. MVC is the big skill you learn hear. Code Igniter is just one framework to use that skill. Code Igniter is a great framework, but there are many jobs that need people who know MVC design. Once you learn how MVC works, it's easy to translate it to different frameworks and languages. I really like how Edwin codes on the fly, and then debugs stuff right there in the video. Some instructors come off like the never make coding errors. That's just not realistic. You also have to know how to debug and look up documentation. Because that's how it is in the real world. Getting this course and MVC under my belt is really starting to advance my career.

results.content: Edwin goes through the major application features and how to build them using CodeIgniter.  He covers all of the CRUD methods, plus some bonus items like sessions and active navigation.  I came to this course already knowing procedural PHP, so I appreciated the faster pace so I could learn CI quickly and get back to building my app!
